Docs.summary: Represents a tab in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use a RibbonTab to organize related groups of commands in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon>. The RibbonTab hosts one or more <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGroup> instances. A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGroup> then hosts controls that represent application commands.
The following list shows the typical hierarchy of elements in a RibbonTab.
- <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon>
- RibbonTab
- <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGroup>
- <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonRadioButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonToggleButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonCheckBox>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTextBox>
- <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonComboBox>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonMenuButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonSplitButton>
- <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonControlGroup>
## Examples The following example shows the markup for a simple ribbon tab.
[!code-xml[Ribbon_Snippets#RibbonTabDefault](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/wpfribbonapplication1/mainwindow.xaml#ribbontabdefault)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method undoes the effects of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTab.PrepareContainerForItemOverride%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the that this tab is in.
Docs.value: The contextual tab group that this tab is in; or if this tab is not in a contextual tab group. The registered default is . For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks You use a *contextual tab* to display groups of commands that are relevant only in a particular context. Contextual tab groups are shown or hidden based on specified criteria. For example, an Ink Tools tab group might be shown when tablet input is detected, or a Picture Tools tab group might be shown when an Image object is selected. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows a named **Pens** that is in the **Ink Tools** contextual tab group. ```xaml                              ```

Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut for the control.
Docs.value: The keyboard shortcut for the control. The registered default is . For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks A KeyTip must be from 1 to 3 uppercase characters, and must not contain spaces, tabs, or newline characters. KeyTips are sometimes known as access keys or accelerators and are used as shortcut key combinations that activate controls. KeyTips appear on the when you press the ALT key. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
